Yes, I was too much for you last battle. I will go easier on you this time.
Very well, we shall try again.
You bit off more bread than you could swallow last time. Perhaps this time will go better for you.
You leap into a sea full of sharks!
A daring rescue that will be the subject of a hundred poems.
I have looked into the eyes of my enemy and I do not like what I see there.
I see your soldiers. Do not think they are hiding.
Is this a raid? Are you sure you are ready? I will not go easy on you.
The hare was angry at the mountain, but the mountain was unaware of it. Your army is meaningless.
You prey on those who cannot defend themselves. There is no honor in that.
An army that size... I suspect they do not bring tidings of your imminent surrender.
In case your runners have been lost. Your army has strayed into my territory. I would advise you to withdraw.
Suleiman the Magnificent will not forget how you attacked this colony.
Ah... a scouting party. A wise man speaks of what he sees.
There is no need for a guide to a village which is visible.
I see your colony, there. I told my cartographers not to bother adding it to their map.
A bird steals bread from beneath the nose of the unwary.
Better to die on an empty stomach than live on an empty one. You have eaten, yes?
A single misfortune is better than a thousand warnings!
A good man will appear when talked about. You must have said my name.
He who steals a minaret prepares a case for it.
When you are an anvil, be patient; when you are a hammer, be strong.
A carefree head is only found on a scarecrow.
I admit defeat. Will you accept my surrender?
I have struggled against you long enough. Shall we call this finished?
Enough! You have won. I will resign if you will permit me.
Thorns and roses grow on the same tree. The rose you have found will soon show you its thorns.
Do not think Suleiman is blind to the tendrils you spread across the New World.
Your explorer is eager. He better watch out for bears. And janissaries.
I am sure news of your discovery will make all the effort worthwhile.
I think I heard a clinking of coin into your coffers. Spend it wisely.
Be careful of the Food in this New World. Especially the choke cherries.
Send my compliments to your explorer for his collection of unusual vermin and weeds.
Stay away from my town. The sheep separated from the flock gets eaten by the wolf.
Native Americans know these lands well, I curse that I did not find him before you did.
You will have need of every settler you have when I begin my attacks.
You should use that wood to build a boat and sail home. Or perhaps I can loan you a swift Ottoman Galley.
Build defenses if you must, but an over-protected eye always gets the speck.
Do you forget I am Ottoman? I will bring artillery to knock down your silly walls.
My skillful diplomats have forged alliance with the natives here while you ignore them.
The wealth of the Ottoman Empire is built on trade. Why should the New World be different?
All the New World is Suleiman's to explore.
If you could only see how much wealth we have amassed!
I fly in like a hawk to grasp a treasure right under your nose.
You seem to be having trouble finding treasures. Would it help if I pointed them all out to you?
The Ottomans accept people of all cultures into our glorious Empire.
More population for the Ottoman Empire!
I will use this wood to make more buildings for the Ottoman Empire.
It will not be long before the native Americans see your true treachery.
No one will want the worthless trinkets you peddle at your trade post
My armies will crush the victory you seek. But where will they strike?
There are many places you must defend. But where will Suleiman attack?
My victory is inevitable. Surrender and I will treat you and your soldiers to a feast in my colony.
The moment of my victory approaches. I can hear the bombards sounding.
I see you have learned that every downhill has an uphill. And every uphill, a downhill.
I hear your name in the whispers of conquered foes. I would watch your back.
You have fought more battles since last we met. My tent is lined with banners of experienced leaders like you.

Beefeater: No, the gin was named after us, you see.
Beefeater: Had to work 22 years to earn the right to wear this hat.
Beefeater: We're granted an extra ration of beef, see?
Beefeater: No, I will not pose with tourists.
Jack: I've never even been to Whitechapel.
Jack: No, you've got the wrong guy.
Jack: Nobody goes to the East End.
Jack: There are those who call me... Graeme.
Strelet: Where were you last Tuesday night?
Strelet: We have ways of making you talk.
Strelet: The Czar is watching you.
Strelet: Nyet, I've not seen Anastasia.
Strelet: We don't call him The Terrible for nothing.
Strelet: You are going to be disappeared.
Strelet: No, I'm Boris. He's Ivan.
Hunchback: I gets to ring the bell.
Hunchback: I like to say hi to the pretty ladies.
Hunchback: My friends call be Quasi.
Hunchback: They had to cut my benefits.
Hunchback: Wait, this isn't Notre Dame.
You must first enter a name to retrieve a forgotten password. Please try again.

Napoleon can be ambitious to the point of rudeness. He adapts his strategy to the situation, but prefers to attack with large armies of fully upgraded units, especially cavalry. He taunts his enemies frequently and may not follow his allies' lead.
Queen Elizabeth can be aloof, aristocratic and formal. She is a dependable if not overly warm ally. She understands the value of a strong economy and a versatile navy.

Queen Isabella of Castille is supportive bordering on flirtatious with her allies but mocks and chastises her enemies. She makes full use of the versatility of the Spanish army, but never leaves her colonies undefended. She is unlikely to take dangerous risks.

Ivan the Terrible is ruthless, sinister and threatening. He taunts enemy and ally alike. He likes to attack early and swarm his opponents with infantry and emphasizes large armies at the expense of technological development.

Maurice of Orange is all business. Every conversation is a transaction and every decision revolves around profit. He views war as a necessary part of business. He looks for Trade Routes when possible, but always defends his colonies.

Henry the Navigator is calculating and far-sighted. He emphasizes exploration and economic development over military dominance. He can take offense easily and can be something of a zealot when dealing with non-Portuguese.

Frederick the Great is proud and confident. He expresses regret when his men die in battle, but does not hesitate to use his entire military might to accomplish even the smallest task. Frederick will not neglect his economy, but believes in attacking aggressively.
Suleiman the Magnificent is scholarly and even-tempered. He balances colony development, trade, improvements and military. He is gracious to allies but may underestimate opponents.
Aristocrat: I can see how you think that might be better.
Aristocrat: I have heard you feedback, and ignored it.
Girl: Mommy, where do babies come from?
Artist: This piece? I call it man with no job.
Torchy: I might look good, but I have burns on two-thirds of my body.
Butcher: They call me Schwettie. Care for a famous Schwettie sausage?
Nice Lady: And now the money just rolls in.
Beefeater: No, no, I'm a vegetarian.
Jack: That's not a razor. This is a razor!
Policeman: Let me introduce you to Billy. Billy club!
Strelet: The health plan's not good, but I do get to beat people up.
Strelet: My five brothers were all strelets too.
Strelet: I come from a family of seventy. We're all strelets.
Vendor: Come and get your cookies. Cheap. Slightly used.
Vendor: You break it, I break you.
Vendor: Turnips! Fresh turnips! Old ones too.
Vendor: Eel! Get your fresh eel right here!

Ships a Factory Wagon to your colony, allowing you to construct a powerful Factory to produce resources or heavy artillery. Permits you to have an extra Factory, +4 Uhlans.
Ships a number of German Black Rider Mercenaries. Instead of Uhlans, you get extra Riders.
Ships a number of Landsknecht mercenaries. Instead of Uhlans, you get extra Landsknecht.

Ships a number of Finnish Hackapell Mercenaries. Instead of Uhlans, you get extra Hackapells.
Ships a number of Landsknecht, Black Riders and Jaegers mercenaries. Instead of Uhlans, you get extra mercenaries.
Ships a number of Highlander, Reislaufer and Hackapell mercenaries. Instead of Uhlans you get extra mercenaries.
Ships a number of Stradiot, Mamelukes and Corsair mercenaries. Instead of Uhlans, you get extra mercenaries.

The Fraunhofer IIS MPEG Layer-3 Codec (l3codecx.ax) cannot be found on this computer. It is a required component of Microsoft DircectShow, and is required for proper sound playback in Age of Empires III. Please quit out and reinstall this codec before continuing. If you choose to continue, an alternative audio codec may be used which may cause problems including choppy sound, missing sound, delayed sound and possible game crashes.

Andes is a mountainous region with the warring factions starting dangerously close. A Trade Route with three Trading Post sites separates the teams. Four Inca settlements are on the far side of the map. Allying with all the Natives is potentially powerful.
 
 
Natives: Inca
Outlaws: Desperado, Renegado

California is a beautiful area along the Pacific Ocean. Towering redwoods line the shore, giving way first to mountains, then to the Mojave Desert to the east. Two Native settlements of Klamath and/or Nootka are on opposite map sides, and there are always four Trading Post sites along the Trade Route.
 
 
Natives: Klamath, Nootka
Outlaws: Renegado, Comanchero

Northwest Territory is a green and rainy region along the Pacific Coast of North America. Resources are plentiful, and Klamath and Nootka villages can be found nestled among the trees. Control the crossings and the resource-rich region across the main river to ensure victory.
 
 
Natives: Nootka, Klamath
Outlaws: Renegado, Desperado

Hispaniola: a large island surrounded by warm tropical seas.\nNatives: Carib\nOutlaws: Buccaneer, Cutthroat

Surrounded by sea, Hispaniola promises conflict on both land and water. Inland, Carib tribes live in the jungles, around the base of an impassable mountain.
 
Extra starting crates of Food will help you jump start your early economy. Whales in the western bay are a strategic secondary source of Coin.
 
 
Natives: Carib
Outlaws: Buccaneer, Cutthroat

Perhaps the reports about the Mohawk and Seneca allying with the British have been exaggerated.
Looks like you've got a bit of fight left in you, uncle.
We're here to help if we can, war chief.
We'll have to decide how many of our villagers should be dancing, and how many should be gathering and building.
I can hear war drums across the river. We need a strategy, and soon.
We should bring plenty of cavalry when we attack the Seneca.
The Mohawk town center has been destroyed. Mission accomplished!
The Seneca town center is down. Mission accomplished!
We should journey to the Oneida Iroquois village.
I know this region well. I used to hunt here as a boy.
The Mohawk copper mines are far from their village. Attacking the miners would be a good way to slow their economy.
The more villagers that dance at the fire pit, the better.
These are the Mohawk copper mines.
Greetings, Nathaniel. We are being raided by two tribes across the river.
We accept your help in our battle.
The Mohawk Iroquois live to the northeast. The Seneca Iroquois live to the northwest.
Battles between Iroquois tribes are often decided by a swift show of force. If we destroy one tribe's town center, the other tribe will stop fighting as well.
We should focus our attacks on one tribe while defending our own village.
You are right. But we have learned that the Seneca tribe is vulnerable to attacks by cavalry.
Our villagers must join the war dance at the fire pit.
Perhaps the reports about the Mohawk and Seneca allying with the British have been exaggerated.
The war party has been assembled.
Another settler has joined us at our trading post!
We've got to destroy the stockade holding my mother before the Mohawk become too strong to defeat.
You're a fool, Kuechler - you and the Mohawks you've tricked into joining you.
We must protect them as they work to expand our military strength.
There are two trading post sites. One has already been claimed by the Mohawks, but we can change that.
Each time a travois passes our trading post, a new villager will join us.
Our base has no villagers. To build and expand we must free villagers being held captive by the Mohawk and their Hessian allies.
There are other villagers being held. The more we free, the faster we can expand our base.
We should kill more of the enemy's villagers while we continue to rescue more of our own.
The locals fight well, with Hessian leadership.
The Mohawks have allowed some of our prisoners to be freed. I should have stationed more of my mercenaries at that pen.
The Natives stand no chance against trained mercenaries.
The Native woman is my prisoner and she shall remain so.
Side with Oneida, boy, and be wiped out with them.

Hold Breed's Hill until reinforcements arrive.
Protect the redoubt on Breed's Hill.

You will lose if British troops reach the redoubt, and you have no soldiers of your own nearby. The British will be attacking Breed's Hill from different angles. Keep troops in the redoubt to defend against land attacks.
Cross the Delaware River and strike terror into the hearts of the British.
Cross the Delaware River and destroy the Hessian tents.
Light a signal fire at the two flagged locations.
Destroy Cornwallis' rear guard stationed in Princeton.
The Hessians are camped in Trenton. Their patrol from tent to tent. Watch where the patrol goes and avoid it, then sneak in and destroy the tents.
Use Nathaniel to build a signal fire at each of the flagged locations. The fires will fool Cornwallis into thinking your army has camped and lure him out of Princeton.
Your group of colonial militia is too small to take on Cornwallis' army. You can, however, flank the main group heading for Trenton and strike at the smaller rear guard still stationed in Princeton.

Get some more men to the redoubt.
We have to hold it until Ward's men arrive.
Use the guns to take out the ships.
We need more troops defending the redoubt. If it falls, we've lost.
Watch for soldiers flanking the front.
We've held off the British! Everyone fall back!
The British have taken the redoubt. We've lost!
Steady, men. We've got to hold on to the redoubt.
General Ward's men will be in place soon.
The British are coming across from Boston Harbor.
British ships are trying to attack our flanks.
British forces have captured the western gun.
The eastern gun has been captured.
General Ward's men are in place.
Another British ship is coming in from Boston.
We've captured the Hessian garrison here in Trenton.
It's working. Cornwallis is on his way here from Princeton.
Cornwallis is sending a patrol back to Princeton. Let's give them a warm welcome.
These people are loyal to the cause. They will help us to keep an eye on Cornwallis' army.
The British are holding prisoners on those ships. We should destroy them and free the prisoners.
The Hessians have a falconet in that garrison. We should be able to capture it.
Cornwallis has heard the fighting. He's sending a patrol to investigate.
Be careful of the patrol around Trenton.
Since the colonials are in retreat, we will only have one patrol tonight.
It sounds like the Hessians are enjoying the celebration.
If we can avoid patrols and take out the tents in Trenton, we should catch them off guard.
We don't have the manpower to take on his main army.
Build some fires to trick Cornwallis into thinking we've made camp for the night.
Excellent. Move out and attack his rear guard.
Take out the rear guard now!
The rear guard in Princeton has been destroyed.
Early automatic-fire weapon. Better against infantry than buildings.
Revolt by mustering all your military force, and become a new nation!
My father Nathaniel Black was a hero of the American Revolution, who fought with the colonial army at Bunker Hill, Trenton and Saratoga...
...and he was there at the end, at Yorktown.
But his story begins six years earlier, in the Iroquois village where he had grown up.
The six nations of the Iroquois Confederacy split apart as the fires of the American Revolution spread northward.
Nathaniel's world would never be the same.
So the Seneca have joined with the Mohawk?
Yes. Both tribes think the British will protect them.
This is a white man's war. We must counsel the Seneca and the Mohawk to stay out of the fight.
Uncle Kanyenke, if we don't choose a side, one will be chosen for us. We must defend our homes.
It's not a matter for young warriors to decide.
No more, Nathaniel. You will accompany me to the villages of our brothers. You will be silent. You will learn.
Colonel Kuechler, here are the captives the Mohawk took from the Oneida village.
How many warriors can your village muster?
You will know when they come for your head.
Do not mistake me for some soft Englishman.
You may know how to make war against your own kind, but you face Hessians now.
My orders are to cleanse these woods of rebels. If your people get in my way, they die.
Some joined the British, while others, like Kanyenke and Nonahkee, helped the colonial cause.
Whether he was driven by a desire to live up to his father John's legacy, or he simply wanted to learn more about the outside world, I never knew.
When the call went out for militia volunteers, Nathaniel and other young men from the frontier headed south, to Boston...
I'm Captain Nathaniel Black. Where are we needed?
The British have landed near Breed's Hill - follow me!
In the early days of the Revolution, the Americans were always on the defensive - pushed out of Boston, out of New York.
George Washington took command of the colonials, determined to make a real army out of ragtag militiamen.
But even Washington's leadership could not stop the British tide.
By December of 1776, the Americans had been pushed back across the Delaware to McKonkey's Ferry.
It was there my father's militia joined them.
General Washington...I'm honored to meet you, sir.
The honor is mine, Captain Black. Your father John was a good man.
I would be pleased to have you think the same of me one day.
I'm sorry we missed the fight in New York.
Perhaps you would have changed the outcome.
But you're here in time to help us turn the tide. The Hessian garrison has settled into their winter quarters in Trenton.
Yes. They're camped right across the Delaware.
I've got unfinished business with the Hessians.
Good. Let's give them a holiday to remember.
Capture the cannon at the Hessian Garrison
Find and destroy the Hessian base.
Find and destroy the second Hessian base.
Blast a path through the main Hessian base.
Pursue and destroy Kuechler's army before it destroys the Morristown Capitol building.
Scouts report the Hessian base may be to the north.
The second Hessian base is thought to be located beyond the swamps to the northeast.
Artillery is the best weapon to use to knock down buildings and walls.
The swift cavalry units that Washington gave you may be the most effective way to attack Kuechler's army in time.
Kuechler may be defeated by a concerted attack.
Destroy all enemy Barracks and War Huts.
Destroy all Enemy Barracks and War Huts. Do not let four Mining Camps be destroyed.
Allow no Trading Posts to be destroyed.
Allow no Mining Camps to be destroyed.

You may need to train many military units and divide them into two or three armies. Consider stationing your armies where they can quickly respond to attacks on your Mining Camps and main base. Change your orders in your Trading Posts to receive those resources you most need.
To defend all of your Trading Posts may require you to station several armies in different places around the map.
To defend all of your Mining Camps may require you to station several armies strategically around the map.
Earn the trust of the Sioux.
Earn 300 Experience Points for each Sioux warrior prisoner returned to the flagged area in the Sioux village.
Earn 100 Experience Points for each crate of resources gathered.
Earn 2,000 Experience Points for rescuing the Sioux War Chief and returning him to the flagged area in the Sioux village.
Earn 150 Experience Points for each Outlaw killed.
Earn 1,000 Experience Points for building a Trading Post on the trade route.

Completing secondary objectives will help you reach your primary objective. You cannot train Settlers from your Town Center. However, your Miners and any Settlers you send from your Home City can gather from any resource crates you find or steal.
Sheriff Holme may be hiding somewhere in the caves to the northwest.

Sioux prisoners are being held at different locations around the map. After you free a prisoner from a stockade, you must bring him to the flagged area in the light blue Sioux village to collect Experience Points for the rescue.
Some crates of resources are guarded. Kill the guards before sending in your Miners to gather from them.

There may be a back route through the canyons near the Sheriff's base, through which the Sioux War Chief can be more easily rescued. After you free the Sioux War Chief from the stockade, you must bring him to the flagged area in the light blue Sioux village to collect experience for the rescue.
Bring plenty of soldiers when fighting bandits.
There may be a Trading Post socket to the northeast of your base.
A campfire that heals nearby units and has a good line of sight.
Storage building for ammunition and weapons.
Attack and hitpoints increased for Aennas & Tomahawks. Requires Fire Pit.
Intensive Zapotec battle training increases hand infantry damage.
Using Zapotec agricultural methods, your Villagers gather from Berry Bushes, Mills, Farms, Plantations, Cherry Orchards, and Rice Paddies faster.
Mountain-dwelling allies of the Zapotec provide you with approximately 100 high-altitude Wood in crates for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
Using Cheyenne methods, you are able to mount your cavalry more quickly, which trains them faster.
A herd of 12 Bison appears at your Home City Gather Point.
The Huron Fishing Wedding ritual boosts your Fishing Boat gather rate.
The Huron Sun Cult increases the number of Huron Mantlets you can train.
The Huron mercantile monopoly permits you to get approximately 1 Mantlet for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
Wall hitpoints increased. Requires Fire Pit.
The Cheyenne thirst for revenge! Cheyenne warriors do additional damage to enemy cavalry.
The Apache secrets of endurance improve all your military's speed.
The Apache tribe knows how to utilize cactus for food, drink, and fiber, improving Settler speed and hitpoints.
Apache raiding tactics enable your Apache warriors to inflict far more damage on enemy Settlers.
Mapuche warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Mapuche warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Klamath tactical skill enables your Klamath warriors to inflict far more damage.
It's the early fall Huckleberry Feast! You get approximately 100 Food in crates for every 3 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
Klamath dedication to labor and ownership causes all your Villagers to gather slightly more quickly.
Skilled Navajo workers make your goods more valuable, increasing your Coin gather rate across the board.
Navajo sheep raising skills let your herd animals fatten much more quickly on a Livestock Pen, Farm, Village, Shrine, Sacred Field, or House.
Navajo weaving talent gives all your soldiers superior garb, granting them all more hitpoints.
Protect your cannons to take down the two enemy fortifications.
Use the Town Wagon to construct a Town Center.
Build up your town and train an army to take out the Yorktown Town Center.
Sophisticated Mapuche legal system strengthens your social structure and lowers the Coin cost of your units.
As the York River towers are destroyed the French will send you more ships. Three Petards are needed to take down each tower.
Siege and many troops will be needed to take destroy the Redoubt Cannons.
Axe Riders get the Nature Friendship ability.
Formal European recognition of the Mapuche nation provides approximately 100 Coin in crates for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
Mapuche guerrilla techniques make your hand infantry even more deadly against buildings.
"We will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
"We will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
"We will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
"We will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
The villagers near Charlestown have offered to help us.
We need to reinforce Breed's Hill and hold it until Ward's men arrive.
Increases Warchief's pets' hitpoint and sends 1 pet bear
Great Heart: all nearby units have their hitpoints boosted. Passive ability.
The mysterious Unknown!\n \nSnow or desert, land or water, Trade Routes or Natives or both - you never quite know what you're going to get. Expect the unexpected!
General Cornwallis is using the Capitol in Trenton as a headquarters for his army. Use the help from the people of Princeton to build up an army and destroy this valuable target.
I thought we were going to die on those ships. Thank you.
Now that the rear guard has been destroyed, the people are offering their help.
Get more soldiers ready. Put everything we have into destroying that town center.
At the dawn of the American Revolution, the Iroquois Confederacy faced its greatest challenge.
Nonahkee has been kidnapped! Nathaniel and Kanyenke race to her rescue, hoping to discover the identity of her captors.
Nonahkee has been rescued, but her reunion with her son Nathaniel will be a brief one...
In the early days of the Revolution, the colonials were pushed back time and time again - until Washington took command.
The British army's summer push down the Hudson River Valley seemed unstoppable - but their supply lines were thinly stretched.
A hard winter awaited the colonial army at Valley Forge... but Nathaniel's militia was there to help.
Throughout the war, Colonel Kuechler eluded Nathaniel - until finally, they would face off near Morristown.
When the French entered the war on the American side, the colonists were finally able to throw off Britain's yoke at Yorktown.
Long-ranged infantry with low hitpoints, but good against heavy infantry and light cavalry.
Automatically generates units of your choice.
Put them to work gathering resources, and keep our men in the redoubt.
We'll need to train more soldiers if we're going to hold off the British.
The British will be attacking soon.
Sir! Lookouts report the British are about three minutes away.
British troops have been spotted in Boston. They'll be here any minute.
Generates resources or artillery automatically. Configure it to produce different things.
We need to take out their outposts to clear an area for our forward base.
Good work, men. Supplies have arrived for Washington's army. Let's set up our town center and get to work right away.
The French have sent word that they have arrived to assist us.
This base will do just fine. Train an army and drive the British from Yorktown!
The redoubts will need to be destroyed before we can hope to penetrate Yorktown.
All of the outposts along the river must be destroyed for more of the French Navy to arrive.
Take these petards and destroy the British outposts along the river.
The French Navy is waiting out in the Atlantic. Once the York river is safe we will be able to attack.
We can send more ships if more outposts are destroyed.
The men won't last long working out in this cold.
The bakers in town will give us food, though it won't be free.
Money shouldn't be an issue. I'm sure my grandchildren will understand...
We'll just have to make sure we avoid British patrols.
Perhaps these Iroquois can help us out.
Get that food cart back to the camp.
Watch out for British patrols while you're heading back to Valley Forge.
We have enough food. Get those huts built.
General, the food stores are full!
We'll never last the winter in these tents. We need to get the men busy building proper quarters.
Good. Now we'll need to concentrate on getting enough food to feed the troops.
The colonial army has no money right now.
Maybe some of the local tribes have some food they can give us.
Get back to the fires if it gets too cold.
Excellent work everyone. The colonial army has survived to fight another day.
We have barely enough supplies for our own survival.
But perhaps some of our people can help out.
We have no food to spare, but my people will hunt for you.
Yes, these should do nicely, General.
Kuechler does have a small base here. Let's destroy it.
Quick! We must use the route he's shown us to reach Kuechler's siege army!
Kuechler's siege army is on the move!
Kuechler's siege army is halfway to Morristown.
Kuechler's army has begun to siege Morristown.
Kuechler's siege army is smashing its way east through Morristown.
We've got to stop them before they destroy the Morristown capitol!
Cavalry are the most effective units against artillery.
Better watch our flanks; Kuechler knows these swamps better than we do.
Kuechler's troops are attacking our base through a southeast route.
I'm not sure what Kuechler is up to on our north flank, but I don't want another surprise like we had at Bound Brook.
These artillery pieces from my cannonworks should help take care of whatever you find up there.
As you destroy Hessian buildings I will supply you with additional artillery units.
Here are more artillery units to help you, Nathaniel.
Here is another artillery piece, Nathaniel.
Kuechler has begun to attack the capitol! You must destroy his siege army!
Nathaniel, here are my swiftest cavalry. Use them to help stop Kuechler!
You will never stop me in time!
No - I will not be defeated by you! NO!
The Hessians have held me prisoner - thank you for rescuing me.
The Hessian's main base is farther north. He has been working secretly to assemble a large siege army.
Colonel Kuechler plans to advance with his siege army to Morristown on a secret path through a swamp west of here. He means to destroy the capitol!
I will show you the only route to pursue Kuechler's siege army before he destroys the capitol.
You've done it! Kuechler and his Hessians are defeated.
Perform a War Dance to boost unit hitpoints.
Your Villagers are performing a War Dance to boost unit hitpoints.\nCurrent Benefit:\n{danceDescription}
Perform a Green Corn Dance to boost infantry speed.
Your Villagers are performing a Green Corn Dance to boost infantry speed.\nCurrent Benefit:\n{danceDescription}
Perform a Town Dance to increase building hitpoints and attack.
Your Villagers are performing a Town Dance to increase building hitpoints and attack.\nCurrent Benefit:\n{danceDescription}
The food and wood here are scarce. We'll have to rely on our trading posts.
The scouts report Mexican bandits and rival French miners are willing to fight for control of these hills.
We must protect the mining camps!
We've destroyed an enemy barracks - good work.
That war hut has been destroyed.
One of our trading posts is under attack!
We've done it! We've taken out every barracks and war hut in the Black Hills.
We can't afford to lose too many more trading posts.
You know what's bad about gold? It attracts flies.
The vermin 'round here want to destroy the mining camps.
Your job is to protect the mining camps, while taking out their war huts and barracks.
They've destroyed one of our mining camps!
Another mining camp has been destroyed.
You'll never make deputy fighting like that.
You allowed three mining camps to be destroyed. Never send a boy to do a man's job.
Light artillery. Better against infantry than buildings.
A falconet that doesn't belong to you - yet.
A mortar that doesn't belong to you - yet.
A cannon that doesn't belong to you - yet.
A rocket that doesn't belong to you - yet.
My scouts report Colonel Kuechler's Hessians are moving on our north flank.
Intercept him before he cuts our supply line.
I knew you were the man for the job.
This war, this revolution - it's larger than any one man.
I know Kuechler has wronged you personally.
But your father's desire for revenge led him to his death.
General Washington, my father gave his life to protect the colonies. I would do the same, without hesitation.
Your enlistment is up next month. You could go back home to your family.
My place is with the Colonial Army until our nation is free.
I'll fight at your side until the war is won.
After the battles at Trenton and Princeton, Nathaniel's militia was sent north, into the wilderness along the Canadian border.
His men skirmished with the British up and down the Hudson Valley throughout the spring.
But the fighting was indecisive until late summer, near Saratoga.
There's the British column. They're headed to Albany.
Captain... if they get that far, they'll cut our army in two.
Send scouts to mark their route. We'll whittle them down and force them to fight here.
After Colonel Kuechler's death, Nathaniel kept his promise to Washington.
And he was there at the end, at Yorktown in 1781, face to face with the redcoats for the last time.
Saratoga was a great victory, but there were many trials ahead.
The British and the Hessians pushed back hard, defeating the Americans at Brandywine and Germantown.
In December, the colonial army retreated to its winter camp at Valley Forge and settled in to wait for spring.
General, we can't sit here all winter. The men will starve.
We have no choice. We must reorganize and refit.
Soon we'll face Cornwallis' army head-on. The new recruits need training.
They need food more than training.
I can find my way through enemy lines and bring back the supplies we need.
An excellent plan, but a dangerous one, Captain. Be careful.
War Rifle attack and hitpoints increased.
Axe Rider attack and hitpoints increased.
Axe Rider attack and hitpoints increased.
Tashunke Prowler attack and hitpoints increased.
Coup Rider attack and hitpoints increased.
Canoe and War Canoe hitpoints increased.
Canoe and War Canoe attack increased.

A successful Maple Festival provides you with approximately 500 Coin for every 10 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
A successful New Year Festival provides you with 2000 Experience Points.
Knowledge of the surrounding woodlands provides you with approximately 500 Wood for every 10 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
Call to war! Ten Tomahawks arrive at your Home City Gather Point.
Call to war! Fifteen Tomahawks arrive at your Home City Gather Point.
Are you sure you want to remove this player from the clan?
Are you sure you want to remove %s from the clan?
Failed to initialize the home city.
Stand Ground. Units will assume a completely defensive posture and not move around.
Stores the last selection Game List filter settings.
Painted Desert: open desert with plentiful resources but no trade route.\nNatives: Apache, Navajo\nOutlaws: Renegado, Desperado

Painted Desert is a lonely open range with scattered mesas and rich ore deposits. Hunting is plentiful, but Wood is a little scarcer. Lost cows can also be found wandering among the mesas. Four Apache and Navajo villages line the center of the map.
 
 
Natives: Apache, Navajo
Outlaws: Renegado, Desperado

You cannot afford to break your Treaty.
You can only create one ESO account per CD Key.

Destroy all of the Hessian Town Centers.
The Town Centers in the Hessian bases are easily destroyed by artillery attacks.
Kuechler's army has destroyed the Morristown Capitol. We've failed.
A tree such as maple or white pine. Harvest for Wood.
Native boat that can attack or transport units.
Native boat that can attack or transport units.
Flat-bottomed boat for transporting troops. Can garrison 20 units.
Gather the nearby Wood to light this.
Diverse tropical trees including palms and strangler figs. Harvest for Wood.
Race to build 3 Forts before the British build 3 Forts.
Destroy the Bridge of Boats to delay Kuechler's arrival.

The British Fort Wagons travel along the Trade Route stopping at the Trading Posts as they move south. It is safest to attack the wagons as they travel between these posts, but watch out for British patrols.

After you reach the Fortress Age, you can train Fort Wagons from your Town Center. The British will also be getting wagons. Forts are strong and have a lot of hitpoints, but Fort Wagons and Fort foundations are very fragile and much more easily destroyed, attack these whenever you can.
The Bridge of Boats can be found near one of the British Trading Posts.
When this bridge is destroyed Kuechler's soldiers will be delayed while they secure another way across the Hudson River.
There, now the Hessians will have to cross the river somewhere else.
Too bad for him - we've already destroyed his bridge.
One more wagon to go. Send for the reinforcements!
When we reach the Fortress Age we will be able to train fort wagons from our town center. It will be expensive, but my family's money can help.
Reinforcements! You couldn't have arrived at a better time.
It'll be enough. The British will be building up to claim this territory. Let's build some forts of our own.
We can train fort wagons now.
The British have completed a fort!
The British have two forts. We need to mount an attack, or admit defeat.
We've stopped the British advance! Send runners to Washington!
Captain Black, concede Saratoga or you will lose your entire command.
Nathaniel, the first wagon is right behind me.
This was all that could be spared, Captain.
Remember, we can train fort wagons at the town center.
Nathaniel, we have found Kuechler's outpost and the bridge of boats.
The third British fort is up. We've lost.
Builds buildings, but is consumed by doing so.
War Hut units train much more quickly.
Canoes and War Canoes become cheaper.
Knowledge of the trees and plant life enables you to obtain extra wood. You get slightly more than 100 wood for each minute the game has lasted so far.
Knowledge of wildlife gains you food. You get slightly more than 100 food for every minute the game has lasted so far.
Knowlege of the available resources gains you coin. You get slightly more than 100 coin for every minute the game has lasted so far.
A successful New Year Festival provides you with 2000 experience points.
The War Arrow! You get approximately 1 Dog Soldier for every 3 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
The War Arrow! Three Dog Soldiers arrive at your Home City dropoff point.
The War Arrow! Five Dog Soldiers arrive at your Home City dropoff point.

Your colonial soldiers can gather Wood and build huts, but the harsh winter will take its toll. Move your men to the fires to heal them.
Without Settlers, you will have to find other ways to collect Food. Nathaniel can buy carts of Food in Philadelphia, and others in the area may be willing to help.
Destroy the British Fort on Barren Hill.
Now that the worst of the winter has passed, build up an army and destroy the British Fort.
Survive the winter and strike back at the British.
We've survived the worst of the winter.
The fort is well-protected. Be careful.
Keep at it, men! The fort is nearly down.
We need to strike the British quickly.
Gather the men and take out the fort on Barren Hill.
That's Kuechler - he's off to the east. He'll have to cross the Hudson River to meet up with the British.
The bridge is out. We will have to find another way to cross the Hudson River.
The British only need one more fort.
A soldier who can gather Wood, but not other resources. He looks cold.
This wagon is carrying Food. Move it to Valley Forge.
Fishing Boats are cheaper. Each canoe shipment from now on gives a free Fishing Boat.
Grand Canyon: deep chasm flanked by starting areas.

Good work. Two more forts and we'll control the battlefield.
One more fort and we'll win the battle. Look sharp!
Stop the British advance to Albany.
Building that produces Wood and increases gather rates of nearby units.
Destroy all of the York River Towers with Petards to get more French Monitors. Use the Monitors to destroy the Fixed Guns.
These ships will help you shell the city.
You can see everything your enemies can see!
Allows you to support 100 population without the need for Houses or Town Centers (total population is not increased).

Source of water for the Lake of the Moon. Is it magical?
Destroy the Outpost to open up the pass.
Attack the Outpost when your army is big enough.
Get the Food Cart back to Valley Forge.
Guide the Food Cart safely back to the flagged area inside the Valley Forge camp.
Another food cart is ready to go back to Valley Forge.
Get that food back to camp. The men are hungry.
The food in this cart will help our soldiers. Get it to Valley Forge now.
That tower is preventing help from reaching Valley Forge. We should destroy it.
Thank you. We never would have made it past that tower.
We lost our way in the storm. Can you lead us to Valley Forge?
We got lost in the pass during the storm. Thank you for rescuing us.

Keep some men in the redoubt. If the British take control of it, we've lost.
This baker will sell us food, but it won't be cheap.
Destroy the ships to free colonial prisoners.
Eliminate the Grenadiers guarding the cannon to capture it.
Trunion invention makes artillery more mobile.
Trunion invention makes artillery more mobile.
A dangerous outlaw with a pistol.
A dangerous outlaw with a double barrel rifle.
Sioux horsemanship provides all their mounted warriors with more hitpoints.
Firearm-equipped warriors (Wakina Rifles and Rifle Riders) have a higher attack.
Worship of the Corn God, Cinteotl, recruits approximately 1 Eagle Runner Knight for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
The Aztecs answer the call to battle. Every War Hut spawns four Puma Men!
The War God commands! Three Jaguar Prowl Knights assemble at your Home City Gather Point.
The War God commands! Six Jaguar Prowl Knights assemble at your Home City Gather Point.

Free cotton armor recruits approximately 1 Puma Spearman for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
The Aztec nobles rally, giving you approximately 1 Arrow Knight for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
The Aztec nobility rises to defend their land. Every Nobles Hut spawns four Arrow Knights.
Worship of the God of Wealth, Tezcatlipoca, brings forth approximately 1 Skull Knight for every 4 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
Worship of Cipactli, the sea monster, musters four Tlaloc Canoes.
Emphasis on the Serpent Goddess, Coatlicue, summons approximately 1 Otontin Slinger for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.
You the Falcon Company man? Chayton Black?
Welcome to Fort Laramie. I'm Billy Holme, the quartermaster.
Colonel Carrington asked me to escort you up the Bozeman trail.
I hear Falcon's going to open up a couple of new stations in these parts.
You know, you're not what I expected. You Indian?
My great-grandmother was Iroquois, and... my father was Lakota Sioux.
Don't matter to me what you are, but you might want to keep that to yourself.
The Sioux, they ain't too popular around here.
My father died when I was young. I was raised by my mother.
I'm sorry, kid. I didn't mean to...
Escort the Town Wagon from Fort Laramie to the Trading Post.
Good sites for Trading Posts can be found further up the trail. Watch out for Sioux attacks.
Chayton Black can build Trading Posts. Keep him safe.
A Town Wagon is on the way from Fort Laramie to your new trading post. Keep it safe.
Another good site for a Trading Post can be found further up the Bozeman Trail.

A second Town Wagon is on the way. Keep it safe, but watch your new Town Center too. You will be able to advance to the next age and train military units once the second Wagon reaches its destination safely.
Own two Trading Posts when the scenario ends.
There are only two free Trading Post sites on the map. Fort Laramie's Trading Post does not count.
A successful New Year Festival provides you with 2000 experience points.
Transforms into a mighty Fort for frontier defense.
Precursors to the Inca, the Huari still control parts of the Andes.
Nice work tracking down Crazy Horse, kid. Just like the old days, huh?
What have you done? The Sioux were ready to negotiate.
You're wrong. The Sioux murder anyone they can get their hands on.
Crazy Horse said the miners broke the truce first. Is it true?
It's war now, and the Sioux are gunning for us. Come on.
They should have kept to the trail. This is Sioux country.
To butcher men like that... it's wrong.
I saw a lot of men die at Antietam and Gettysburg, kid. It's never pretty, but you get used to it.
Let's find the ones who did this.
This morning. It's a hard trip up from Boulder City, but I didn't want to miss the opening of the station.
I couldn't have done it without my friend, Billy Holme.
I met him. I think he made a pass at me.
Those Sioux we fought - it was personal for them. They were so angry.
The Sioux aren't what I expected. You told me my father was a gentle man.
He was. The Sioux are just like other people, Chayton - some gentle, some not.
This peace between the settlers and the Sioux... it won't last.
But it's peace, for a while.
We can get the resources we most need by changing the orders at our trading posts.
You have no right to take the gold from these hills.
These hills are just ugly with gold. Why should the Sioux have it all for themselves?
It looks like word of the gold got back to Spain. Now you've got some Spanish miners to fight off too, kid.
The Colonials are ambushing our wagons - stop them!
After Red Cloud's War, the uneasy truce between the Sioux and the settlers held for almost a decade.
When I retired from Falcon Company, I put my son in charge. For years, he was so busy he almost forgot about Red Cloud's War.
Until one day, when an old friend called him back to a town in the shadow of the Black Hills.
The elected representative of the law in these parts, and your humble servant.
Good to see you again, Billy. I rode up as soon as I got your letter. What'd you want to show me?
Heard you're in charge of Falcon Company now. Thought you might want to see what we found out here.
Lots of it. And it's all ours.
We're going to get rich, and you can be a part of it.
The Sioux will be back, and next time, in force.
It's greed, is all. Everyone wants our gold.
The bandits were after the gold, but the Sioux... this is their land. We shouldn't be here.
Then get out there and track down your old pal Crazy Horse. Try to talk some sense into him.
I will. We have to stop this before it becomes a war.
You want to tell me why, Billy?
You know why. You saw the mines.
It's the claim of a lifetime. I would have been rich.
The land belongs to the Sioux. If it had belonged to the settlers, would you have killed them too?
Their blood's the same color. It's gold that matters, kid. Only gold.
Nothing I say is going to stop Custer from butchering your Sioux friends.
Provides a small hitpoint bonus to nearby units and good line of sight.
Bridge of boats across the river.
Raiding light cavalry. Good against shock cavalry and artillery.
Bridge of boats across the river.
Stealthy assassin. Highly effective against villagers, heroes and mercenaries.
Native healer. Heals injured units and dances at the Fire Pit. Can see stealth.
Powerful heavy artillery from the foundries of Russia.
Ships a number of Maltese Hoop Throwers.
You have declared independence from your mother country!
I need to talk to Crazy Horse.
There's a lot of hunting in these lands.
The Sioux can support a large army with all these buffalo.
We can use this cart to clear a path back to the town.
Run that black powder wagon into one of the weapons caches to clear a path.
Another cart! Use it to clear some of those trees.
At last! I need to speak to you. I...
The Sioux are too strong. We have to pull back.
You can try, kid, but don't expect the Sioux to just let you waltz in.
The people in this town will help you out, but I've got something I gotta do in the meantime.
You want me to burn down a village? They haven't done anything!
I can't attack women and children.
Without that fort, you're too exposed to conduct raids.
They're too strong. We don't have the forces to hold them back.
We need to get that fort up, and to do that we need more wood.
Get out there and protect the folks gathering wood.
The fort is up! Now we can clear those Indians off the land.
Get out there and take out that village.
Not yet. Besides, we can't claim the gold until they're off this land.
I've been patient, kid, but I'm getting tired of your attitude.
You're either with us or against us. What's it gonna be?
I thought I taught you better than this, kid.
Bring Chayton to Crazy Horse's camp.
There are many tribes between you and Crazy Horse. You will need military help to fight your way through.
Protect the Settlers gathering Wood for the fort.

Send soldiers to the forest to guard the Settlers against enemy attacks. The Wood they collect will be used to build the fort. Set your Trading Posts to deliver resources so you can train additional defensive units.
You will need to build a sizable army in order to take out the village.
Ally with the Sioux and direct their forces against the fort.
Holme is hiding somewhere in these hills. We'll earn the trust of the Sioux, and they'll help us root him out.
We've established a strong military encampment here, but we have no villagers. Our miners must gather what we need from any resource crates we can find.
We've freed some Sioux braves. Now we must bring them to the flagged area in the Sioux village.
The bandits in this area are running supply wagons of stolen goods through here Kill them and task our miners to collect the resources.
Destroy that bandit's supply wagon. We need the resources it's carrying.
The Sioux will trust us once we've earned enough experience.
Holme has captured several Sioux braves and their War Chief. We should rescue them and return them to the Sioux village.
We can build a trading post on this trade route to gain more experience.
There are renegade outlaws crawling all over these hills. The Sioux will be grateful for every one we eliminate.
A camp of outlaws! Clear them out and we'll take their resources.
It looks like we've found Holme's camp.
We've destroyed Sheriff Holme's town center, but we must still earn the respect of the Sioux before our task is done.
Holme's bandits have overrun our base. We've lost.
You're trapped, Holme. There's no escape.
You have earned my respect, Chayton Black.
There are caves to the north and west of the village. Your enemy may be inside. We will show you a way in.
We have revealed the secret entrance to the caves. Our enemy is hiding somewhere within.
The Sioux will join you. Holme is clever, and may have hidden strength.
There is Holme. His life belongs to you now.
The sheriff's holed up with his bandits in the hills. Most of the locals went with him.
You look like a Sioux to me.
My name is Chayton Black. I own the railroad.
George Armstrong Custer. I've been sent to put a stop to the Indian raids in these parts.
Sheriff Holme's been stirring up trouble between the Sioux and the miners.
He wants to drive the Sioux off their land to claim the gold for himself.
The Indian problem is a lot bigger than some two-bit local sheriff, Mr. Black.
The Sioux and Cheyenne will return to their reservations, or they'll answer to me.
I'll drag Holme back here, and you can hear the truth from him.
Do as you please. I'll be camped here for a while.
The supply trains are fifty miles back, and I'm not moving until my whole command's in position.
You've got your day, Black. Use it well.
Good, here come the militiamen. Let's get that wagon!
This spot is perfect. Keep me covered while I get a trading post built.
A covered wagon is heading up the trail from Fort Laramie.
We've got to protect it from the raiders.
We'll have to protect the new town center while we scout further up the trail for another good trading post site.
Another covered wagon is on the way.
We'll find a good spot for your trading post further up the trail.
Watch your back. This is Sioux country.
Another covered wagon is on the way - look sharp!
The Sioux just keep comin'. We've got to take the fight to them if we're gonna secure the trail.
What has made the Sioux so angry?
We should be able to hire some men in the saloon here.
You walk a difficult path, young warrior. Be careful you do not slip and fall.
You have a warrior's spirit - but do you understand the cause for which you fight?
I will drive your railroad men from these lands.
We will defend this place with our lives.
I don't know, but they've been chasing us for days!
There are lots more men coming up behind us... please save them!
Stealth. Your units will be hidden from enemy units.
We've rescued some workers! We should be able to save more.
Upgrading the trade route to a railroad would increase our income and allow us to hire more mercenaries.
We should put those workers on the mines so we have more coin coming in.
Ships a Fort Wagon to your colony, allowing you to construct a mighty Fort. Permits you to have an extra Fort.
Ships a Factory Wagon to your colony, allowing you to construct a powerful Factory to produce resources or heavy artillery. Permits you to have an extra Factory.
Save 20 Railroad Workers from the Sioux.
Use any Railroad Workers you save to mine gold to help pay for more mercenaries from the Saloon.
Ships a Factory Wagon to your colony, allowing you to construct a powerful Factory to produce resources or heavy artillery, +4 Uhlans.
Ships a Fort Wagon to your colony, allowing you to construct a mighty Fort. Permits you to have an extra Fort, +4 Uhlans.
We did it! The railroad is complete!
We've found the Hole in the Wall Gang's hideout. They've been causing trouble in these parts for quite some time.
Take out the Hole in the Wall Gang's hideout.
Take out the Hole in the Wall Gang's Saloon quickly or more might sober up and join the fight.
Ships a number of Italian Elmetto mercenaries.
Ships a number of Swedish Fusilier mercenaries.
Ships a number of Japanese Ninja mercenaries.
Ships a number of Swedish Fusilier mercenaries.
Ships a number of Italian Elmetto mercenaries.
Major, pursue the Indians and bring them to battle.
We'll support you with the whole command once you engage.
Then we ride. We won't meet much resistance.
Sir, if you'd just meet with Sitting Bull and Crazy Horse...
The time for talking is over, Mr. Black. The Indians are ready to fight, and so am I.
Are you white, or Indian? You can't sit on the fence any longer.
The Cheyenne camps should be close by. Let's find them.
Brave Wolf, the enemy is near - come quickly!
One of the war chiefs has fallen. We need to recover him.
Custer will get reinforcements from these buildings. We should destroy as many as possible.
Custer's scouts! They will call for him when they reach the river! We need to build up.
Gather the war chiefs. I will return.
No one should charge yet - the soldiers are too many.
This Cheyenne camp will be easy pickings!
Bring the three Cheyenne War Chiefs to the Sioux Town Center.
Defend the Sioux camp until General Custer arrives.

Three Cheyenne camps are nearby; find them and bring the War Chiefs to the Sioux town center. All of the Cheyenne camps are all south of the river, but may not be directly accessible. Each War Chief will contribute his forces to the fight once he has arrived at the Sioux town center.

General Custer will send some men ahead to scout out Medicine Tail Coulee. It will take them a while to reach the river crossing, but once there they will call for General Custer and his army. Use the time it takes them to travel to build up and defend against attacks.
General Custer has arrived. Use your warrior army to find and kill him.
Custer's Army has forward bases north of the river. Crazy Horse will send warriors when each of the two forward Town Centers is destroyed.

Destroy the revealed buildings to reduce the number of troops that General Custer will bring across the Little Big Horn River and into the Sioux settlement. You will have to fight through enemy towns to get to most of Custer's buildings.
Ironclad, siege warship. Good at bombarding buildings at great range. Can garrison 20 units.
Build three Trading Posts and upgrade the Trade Route.

If you need Wood for the Trading Posts, you can buy some at the Market. Build three Trading Posts on the Trade Route and then upgrade the route to a Railroad. Switching to Coin deliveries will increase your income so you can hire more mercenaries.
Watch out - there's a Sioux raiding party headed for our town.
Cannot switch to stealth mode when enemy units are nearby.
Destroying the two Sioux Town Centers will secure the trail. Both Town Centers are well-defended.
One minute until end of treaty!
The treaty has ended! Fighting may begin!
Quick moving artillery. Strong against infantry.
During the treaty period, buildings may only be built close to the starting Town Centers.
In the nineteenth century, westward expansion slowed in the face of fierce Native American resistance.
Chayton and Holme have secured the trail, but several groups of settlers are still threatened by Sioux raiders.
The Sioux, led by Red Cloud and Crazy Horse, fought the U.S. Army to a standstill. The fragile truce would hold for almost a decade.
Chayton and Sheriff Holme have defended the gold mines - but what are the Sioux really after?
Holme's actions have dashed Chayton's hopes of a peace settlement. The Sioux are sure to respond in force.
The Sioux and the settlers are at each other's throats. Holme has fled with his bandits, leaving Chayton to pick up the pieces.
Holme is dead, but Custer is on the move... Is it too late to stop a war?
With two trading posts to protect, we'll have Fort Laramie's support. We can age up and train soldiers now.
Yeah, but we won't be able to age up or train soldiers until we get a second trading post built. Let's move.
Royal Decree "Treaty of Tordesillas" Shipment has arrived.
An error occurred connecting to host.
This sorts people in clans together in the chat player list.
%1s has invited you to their team quick match game. Would you like to join?
Standard games have no Treaty.\nDuring Treaty period, enemies cannot be attacked and building is restricted.
Copy the current Deck for this Home City.
Rams into enemy units and buildings, then explodes dealing lots of damage.
Our people dance at the fire pit to invoke power for our tribe.
More villagers have come to join us. We should put them to work gathering resources.
TEAM increased all Crates to 130 resources.
Perform a War Dance to increase the damage your units do.
Your Villagers are performing a War Dance to increase the damage your units do.\nCurrent Benefit:\n{danceDescription}
The standard game, has no Treaty period and allows the Trade Monopoly victory condition.
The classic game, has no Treaty period and does not allow the Trade Monopoly victory condition.
10 minute Treaty period in which no one can attack and building is restricted.\nThe Trade Monopoly victory condition is not allowed.
20 minute Treaty period in which no one can attack and building is restricted.\nThe Trade Monopoly victory condition is not allowed.
30 minute Treaty period in which no one can attack and building is restricted.\nThe Trade Monopoly victory condition is not allowed.
40 minute Treaty period in which no one can attack and building is restricted.\nThe Trade Monopoly victory condition is not allowed.
I'll need to use a black powder cart to blast a path through here.
SPC XP Wood Fort Large Wall
SPC XP Wood Fort Medium Wall
SPC XP Wood Fort Small Wall
Defensive structure to defend the Fort from attacks.
You need to allow more space around the Fire Pit.
Nathaniel! Men with guns came. They took many!
The British are building a fort by the river!
The British are building a fort here!
The British are building a fort in the north!
Grants an extra %1d Experience Points per second
Spawns a new %1s unit every %2.1f seconds (subject to population limits)
Spawns a new %1s unit every %2d seconds (subject to population limits)
Heals %1.1f%% of idle units' health per second
Heals %1d%% of idle units' health per second
Resurrects your War Chief at the Fire Pit if he is down
Trains local Mercenaries and Native units you are allied with.
This Deck cannot be modified. Copy it to make changes.
This Home City already has a Deck by that name that is used by an expansion pack.
The war council has spoken - prepare for battle!
Crazy Horse, I could not convene the war council in time. I have failed you and the Sioux.
We are grateful for your aid, Two Moon.
Your dog soldiers are a welcome sight, Bull Bear.
The Sioux are grateful for your help, Brave Wolf.
Benteen! What have you done with my artillery?
Reno! Why didn't you pay the mercenaries?
Reno! My infantry! Where are they?
Set our trading posts to deliver resources. We've got to keep those workers safe.
An old weapons cache. If we find some way to ignite it, we can clear that path.
I am launching an assault on this redoubt. Can you spare troops to help?
We've rescued as many villagers as we can. Let's get trading posts up and the railroad built to secure the region.
We've failed to protect the town!
Upgrades Command Posts to Command Centers which can train special mercenaries, have increased attack and hitpoints, and outlaw-type units cost less population.
Good idea - the more trading posts we have, the richer we'll get!
Increases the amount Surgeons can heal and Field Hospital build limit.
Fast building and cheap tent. Supports 5 population.
Flying surveillance unit with huge line of sight.
Unlocks the ability to train Surgeons from the church. Increases the amount Surgeons can heal.
Increases the amount Surgeons can heal and Field Hospital build limit, +2 Uhlans.
You can now construct up to 3 Saloons.
Upgrades Command Posts to Command Centers which can train Winged Hussars, have increased attack and hitpoints, and outlaw-type units cost less population, +2 Uhlans.
You can now train Cows from Houses and each House can herd two more animals.
You can now train Llamas from Houses and each House can heard two more animals.
Bonds between you and minor Native tribes increase the attack of Embassy warriors and increases Embassy build limit.
Spies become Assassins, which do more damage to normal units and vastly more damage to War Chiefs, Explorers, Monks, and Mercenaries. Also they get a Backstab Attack ability.
Spies become Agents, which have greatly increased line of sight and more hitpoints. Also they get a Pistol Attack ability.
Grenadiers do more damage, especially vs. buildings.
Musketeer / Grenadier Combat Shipment has arrived.
More of the French Navy has arrived to help control the York River.
I'll get the signal fires built.
We can get more food from the bakers near the town to the southeast, but we'll have to slip by the British patrols.
Ships an advanced Hot Air Balloon that remains permanently in play.
Falconets, Cannon, Culverin, and Horse Artillery damage increased.
Skills adapted from building the colossal Russian base in Sevastopol permit you to construct defenses with incredible speed (Forts, Walls, Blockhouses, and Town Centers).
Dragoons have increased range and line of sight.
Ranged Cavalry does increased damage to Settlers.
All Settlers and Fishing Boats gather faster.
Rice Paddies, Farms, Mills, Sacred Fields, Villages and Plantations are cheaper, and build much more quickly.
Would you like to register The Asian Dynasties expansion pack with your current ESO2 account? You cannot login to ESO2 unless you register.

<font=SmallIngame 12>ATTENTION! You must have an Age of Empires III ESO account to play The Asian Dynasties expansion pack online. If you already have an account, log in and your account will be enabled for The Asian Dynasties online play. If you don't have an account, you must create one. If you have forgotten your credentials, visit www.agecommunity.com.</font>
New methods of rendering Whale oil at sea allow your Fishing Boats to gather from Whales significantly faster.
Mortars get increased range and line of sight.
Ships 1 Bank Wagon for the entire team.
TEAM Crossbows, Longbows and Pikemen train faster.
Doppelsoldner attack and hitpoints increase greatly, but speed drops drastically.
Transforms into a Bank or Plantation.
Halberdiers march significantly more quickly, but do less damage against Infantry.
Siege warrior that dies when it attacks buildings, but does lots of damage.
Ships four powerful Nitro Petards, also enables Petards to be trained from the Artillery Foundry. +4 Uhlans

You have just earned your 21st Card! In the Fire and Shadow campaign, your Deck is limited to twenty Cards, but you are allowed to have multiple Decks. If you're having trouble winning a scenario, try building a different Deck!
Half-Iroquois son of John Black and Nonahkee.
Activates all Big Button Upgrades from all buildings at once, with the exception of the Scouting, Raiding, and War Party.
All Special (Big Button) upgrades have their price greatly reduced.
All Special (Big Button) upgrades have their price greatly reduced.
All Special (Big Button) upgrades have their price greatly reduced.
Resetting your city will refund all points and remove all Decks. This operation may only be performed one time. Are you sure you wish to reset %s?
3 Privateer (pirate) ships show up to assist you.
Sends Mayan warriors and also upgrades them to Elite.
Sends Zapotec warriors and also upgrades them to Elite.
Ships 3 Privateer (pirate) ships show up to assist you.
4 Privateer (pirate) ships show up to assist you.
Teepees are cheaper, harder to destroy, and you can build more of them.
Teepees now boost attack as well as hitpoints.
Crates of 500 Food, 500 Wood, and 500 Coin
Healers (surgeons and Holy Men) have increased speed and hitpoints.
Healers (Surgeons and Holy Men) have increased hitpoints and line of sight.
Healers (Surgeons and Holy Men) have increased speed and can heal faster.
Grenadiers have an increased burst radius and do more damage to buildings.
All Native allies have their hitpoints increased, also ranged Natives get increased range.
Sends Mayan warriors and also upgrades them to Elite.
Sends Zapotec warriors and also upgrades them to Elite.
A large force of outlaws joins your side, with 10 Renegados and 10 Desperados.
Outlaw, Wokou, and Maratha attack and hitpoints increased.
For the rest of the game, a small trickle of Coin enriches you.
For the rest of the game, a small trickle of Food enriches you.
For the rest of the game, a small trickle of Wood enriches you.
We'll need those reinforcements. The Natives won't be happy if we start rebuilding the railroad.
Fort Laramie has sent us more reinforcements.
They're trying to burn down the saloon... get them!
Make a run for the town!
Missionaries can now boost the attack of nearby soldiers.
All your Pikemen transform into Rodeleros.
All your Crossbowmen transform into Skirmishers.
Decreases Cuirassier cost and train time.
When this shipment arrives, all of your current Food is exchanged for an equal amount of Coin.
Arrow Knight attack and hitpoints increased.
All manors slowly heal nearby units.
When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Coin is exchanged for a greater amount of Wood.
South Sea Bubble Shipment has arrived.
Ships a number of Swedish Fusilier mercenaries.
TEAM Sends a band of Hessian Jaeger mercenaries.
When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Food is exchanged for a greater amount of Wood.
Ships a number of Barbary Corsair mercenaries.
Ships 3 Privateer ships to your colony.
From now on, Trade Route upgrades are free and Fame can be received at Trading Posts.
House of Braganca Shipment has arrived.
Your Strelets can now build a Fort, if you've lost one.
All your Strelets transform into Musketeers.
Galleons and Command Posts have more hitpoints and can now train Buccaneers.
We only need to destroy one of the two enemy town centers.
All Native American allies are improved to Champion level. + 4 Uhlans.
All your pikemen transform into rodeleros.
Custer won't get any reinforcements from this building.
Good. No reinforcements for Custer here.
The scouts are halfway to the river.
The scouts are almost at the river!
When the war finally ends, this day will be remembered.
Reno! Benteen! Come on, be quick!
The Sioux already destroyed this building. Custer's gonna be mad.
The Sioux got to this building too. Let's keep moving. Quickly!
We've pushed the railroad as far west as we can. We've got to make peace with the Sioux.
Orinoco: a tropical river map with crossings.\nNatives: Tupi, Carib, Zapotec, Maya\nOutlaws: Desperado, Buccaneer

Orinoco is a tropical region just north of the Amazon jungle. The teams are separated by the mighty Orinoco River, which empties into the Caribbean Sea to the north. Up to four different Native tribes can live in this area, including the Tupi, Zapotec, Caribs, and Maya.
 
 
Natives: Tupi, Carib, Zapotec, Maya
Outlaws: Desperado, Buccaneer
Enables certain European Arsenal improvements in your Longhouses.
Enables certain European Arsenal improvements in your Teepees.
Farm and Plantation upgrades are now free.
All your pikemen transform into rodeleros.
Tashunke Prowler build limit is significantly increased.
Line of sight and range of War Huts, Nobles' Huts and Lookouts increased.
All Shipments from temples and allies are cheaper.
Your War Hut units can build War Huts, Corrals, and Teepees.
Healers can now heal faster, and Scouts line of sight, attack and hitpoints are increased.
War Hut units do greatly increased damage vs. settlers.
All settlers and fishing boats gather faster.
You get an army of Sioux foot warriors.
For the rest of the game, small trickles of Wood and Coin enrich you.
Turns all your Axe Riders into Rifle Riders.
Your War Chief's aura now also boosts your units' attack.
Tomahawks, Aennas, and Mantlet have more attack and hitpoints.
All Siege Workshop troops cost less population.
All Iroquois Siege weapons get increased damage and hitpoints.
American general in charge of the colonial army.

Araucania runs the length of South America's west coast and has plentiful hunting, fishing and whaling. The Mapuche and Inca inhabit this variable landscape of mineral-rich northern deserts, bountiful central grasslands, and treasure-laden southern wastes.
 
 
Natives: Inca, Mapuche
Outlaws: Desperado, Comanchero
Araucania: fight along the western coast of South America.\nNatives: Inca, Mapuche\nOutlaws: Desperado, Comanchero
When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Food is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.
Shipments from the Six Nations are cheaper (Cayuga, Mohawk, Oneida, Onondaga, Seneca, and Tuscarora)
Hurry your men. If we die, we die fighting.
We are close to victory. Be wary of enemy attacks.
You should study the tactics of your enemy. You need more cannon.
Steal horses if you have to, but get more horsemen into that fight.
Men and rifles are what you need. Where are your foot warriors?
This battle favors our enemy. You should withdraw.
The spirits want war. The battle draws in many tribes.
See how they throw away men in useless conflicts.
My father would be proud to give me his name after a battle like that.
My warriors will have this battle won quickly.
Your warriors arrived just in time, as I planned.
Our enemy has help. I fear their combined force may be too strong.
My plans for siege are already in progress.
My warriors will be mounted, and will be here soon.
I will have my people train more foot warriors.
My people do not have the resources for that.
The spirits will not allow that.
My warriors are elsewhere. I have no men to help you.
The spirits prevent me from doing that.
My force is not big enough. I will not send them into slaughter.
Our enemy is sly. They have destroyed a post.
The journey here has not been kind to these British people. There is not much fight in them.
It will not be long before these Dutchmen are mourning their dead.
The French will soon be driven from these lands forever.
Watch as these Germans are driven before our warriors.
See how their warriors fall. This so-called empire can never last.
If only all of our enemies fell as easily as these Portuguese.
The Russian hordes are no match for our superior warriors.
Soon all of the Spanish will vanish from these lands.
These Aztecs will feast on no bones except their own.
It saddens me to crush my Native brothers.
Let this day be a lesson for those Sioux who break from me.
Their voyage has made these British strong.
These Dutch fight with the strength of the buffalo.
Where do the French find such power?
These Ottomans are stronger than I expected.
It pains me that I underestimated these Portuguese.
The strength of the Russians is great.
The spirits give strength to these Spanish.
The reputation of the Aztecs is true. They are quite strong.
The spirits have been kind to my brothers. Their strength is formidable.
It is no surprise these Sioux have the spirits on their side.
Be careful you are not devoting too many resources to advancing in age. The battle ahead will be long.
It would seem our enemy values the superiority of Native warriors.
Move past the Discovery Age. Our enemy grows stronger every second.
Why do you linger behind? Advance in age or our enemy will have the advantage.
A bold move, advancing in age so quickly. But make sure you balance your resources.
I hope that being the last to advance in age is part of a strategy and not just dragging your feet.
You have my thanks for your help.
That is how we deal with enemies who sneak like a snake in the grass.
Our enemy has lost his hold over my Native brothers.
That is how to clean the scourge of settlement from our lands.
With this post down, our enemy will lose sway in this area.
I have failed to liberate my brothers.
Our enemy has grown strong. Not even I could destroy that town.
Our enemy continues to profit from fouling these lands.
My war chief is down and I can not collect treasures.
Killed by an animal? The spirits mock me.
I cannot continue against such odds.
It would be advantageous for you to send help here.
Many men are attacking my town.
Welcome. Follow my lead if you want to win.
I see you think you are ready for a bigger challenge.
It is probably better that you choose an easier game.
I hope you play as well now as you did the last time we met.
I may yet have something to learn from someone who leads like you did last time.
Your last effort disgraced the spirits. Try harder this time.
You will need to do much better this time to keep up with my score.
I remember these lands. That can only add to our tactical advantage.
Do not drag me down this time.
We are strong together. I hope to do well again.
The will of our people has brought our war chief back to us.
Our enemy has failed to protect its Town Center with a barracks.
Our enemy seems to have no horsemen.
Take this wealth and use it wisely.
My people have gathered food for you.
It is time to strike our enemy. I am going after this town.
I am striking at our enemy's villagers.
The time is right. I am attacking our enemy's main town.
I am moving to free my brothers from our enemy's influence.
I am going to strike our enemy's trade post.
You were wise to hit our enemy there. I will follow up your attack.
My warriors will train from here.
My people will set up camp here.
I will seek the help of my Native brothers.
I will take this trade site.
My people will defend this building.
My warriors will defend this area.
I will defend my Native brothers here.
The people in this town will resist to the last man.
I will tell my warriors to defend this trading post.
My people have plenty of wealth. We will send some to you.
Our harvests have been bountiful. We will send you food.
The forests here have given us much. We will continue to send you wood.
My people are on their way to help you here.
The spirits have been quiet lately.
My people have need of coin.
The herds are thin. We need food.
My people need wood to expand our territory.
Your help in that battle was well-timed.
You have my thanks for the coin.
This food will help. Thank you.
Your quick action saved many of my people.
Those resources will nourish my people.
This wood will help us to build.
Their voyage across the sea has made these British strong.
I would not have believed these Frenchmen to be so strong.
These Germans have more fight than I had hoped.
This empire has produced a worthy enemy.
These Portuguese have the strength of the buffalo.
These Russians are a strong-willed people.
These Spanish warriors fight with skill.
The reputation of the Aztecs is well-deserved.
It is no surprise that these Natives are fierce warriors.
Our difficulties against the Sioux are not surprising.
How can we be losing to these weak British?
We struggle against an inferior Dutch army.
I am puzzled by our failure to rout these weak Frenchmen.
These Germans are weak. We should be doing better.
These Ottomans win despite our superiority.
How do these Portuguese better us, the stronger team?
These weak Russians are beating us.
We are losing, despite the weakness of the Spanish.
How can we do better against these weak Aztecs?
We must try harder against these weaker Iroquois.
I know the Sioux are strong, but our armies should be stronger.
You have the strength of a bear, but we are still behind.
I cannot win alone. You must summon more strength.
Our strength is superior to our enemies.
The spirits seem to favor you. You are very strong.
We appear to be ahead, but I need you to find more strength.
It appears our enemies have bested us this day.
Your spirit is strong, but I fear the battle is over.
You are foolish to drag your people into senseless battles. Let us make peace.
Call your warriors! We need to destroy our enemy's trading posts.
Our enemy is wise to seek the aid of the locals.
Our enemy seeks to bolster his economy with a trading post.
Our enemy continues to seek help from the locals.
It seems our enemy has gained the advantage in Trading Posts.
I will ask my brothers for help.
I will take a Trading Post to help our economies.
A fine move getting ahead in Treasures.
That treasure will help us to destroy our enemies.
Use that wealth to train some warriors.
That food will help feed your warriors.
You would seem to be very familiar with these lands, but don't let those treasures distract you.
I'll forgive that, but don't steal from my people again.
I see you have found a warrior to help you.
The Sioux welcome those villagers as their own.
That wood will help you to expand your town.
You are wise to keep us ahead of their Native settlements.
That extra trading post will give us an economic advantage.
I hope those walls are strong. They could never keep out my people.
I know the power of these people. They will help us in our struggle.
Now I have the first trading post. It will be easy for the council to get supplies to me.
This will help me to crush our enemy.
This coin will pay for many warriors.
I know that you did not need this treasure.
What is your war chief doing? He should be out gathering treasures.
See how the Natives flock to our cause?
These villagers will help our cause.
This wood will help to build my settlement.
More Natives will help us out.
Another trading post has been added to our tribe.
These walls will help to defend my people.
The stage is set. Prepare to defend these posts to the last man.
What has happened? You used to be a better leader.
