Buildings cannot be built too close to the King's Hill.
Our fleet has consumed all of the island's gold. I suggest we build a rice paddy to increase our wealth.
At least one Treasure Ship must survive.
Protect your Treasure Ships from being destroyed by the hostiles.
Without the Company's saltpeter sites, Edwardson will be powerless. March west and destroy them.
Locate native resistance fighters and gain their support.
The Company has established a strong presence in the area. Allying with local resistance fighters would enhance your military. Their skill at laying siege are known throughout the land.
Destroy the Company's Mills in the western town.
The soldiers of Edwardson's garrison are supplied by the Mills and Farms to the west. A sure way to get the enemy's attention would be to destroy these resources and cut off the flow of Food.
Kick out your ally so that you can choose a new one.
Kick out your ally so that you can choose a new one.
If the Shah dies, all is lost.
Silk Road: travel the legendary trade route, capturing existing Trading Posts. You begin with a free Market.\nNatives: Shaolin, Zen\nOutlaws: Masterless Samurai, Smuggler

Starting from their Markets at opposite sections of the famed Silk Road, players vie for control of this lucrative Trade Route. Since the map portrays a randomly selected part of the passage, three terrain variations are possible, each with unique characteristics. Players do not need to establish the route, only capture it before the enemy does!
 
 
Natives: Shaolin, Zen
Outlaws: Masterless Samurai, Smuggler
Large Silk Road: Travel the legendary Trade Route, capturing existing Trading Posts. You begin with a free Market.
Siberia: a frozen river divides the map, and a Trade Route runs along the southern edge, with plentiful hunting among the great forests.\nNatives: N/A\nOutlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai
Large Siberia: A frozen river divides the map, and a Trade Route runs along the southern edge, with plentiful hunting among the great forests.

In the distant north, hunting is plentiful among the great forests, and a frozen river separates you from your enemies. The future route of the Trans-Siberian Railway lies to the south.
 
 
Natives: N/A
Outlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai
Mongolia: explore generous grassland populated with unprecedented herds of grazing animals and a distant northern Trade Route.\nNatives: Sufi, Shaolin\nOutlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai

Players begin in generous grassland. To the north lie the fertile slopes of the steppe, where players will have to extend their reach in order to bolster their economies and reach the distant Trade Route. The number of grazing animals is astounding, and can be utilized to great advantage.
 
 
Natives: Sufi, Shaolin
Outlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai
Indochina: a resource-rich land with coastal fishing and many possible alliances.\nNatives: Jesuit, Sufi\nOutlaws: Smuggler, Fugitive Dacoit

With rich coastal waters and plentiful resources, the Indochinese peninsula promises many opportunities for expansion and conflict. A central river provides naval access inland, and numerous religious sites dot the landscape.
 
 
Natives: Jesuit, Sufi
Outlaws: Smuggler, Fugitive Dacoit
Honshu: a narrow strip of land is surrounded with islands, one of which features a tiny Trade Route.\nNatives: Zen, Jesuit\nOutlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai

Players begin on either end of a long narrow island. Mines can be found on the smaller islands nearby. A larger landmass opposite the other coast features a tiny but pivotal Trade Route. The limited supply of Food on the main island will drive players to fish the rich coastal waters.
 
 
Natives: Zen, Jesuit
Outlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai
Regicide - Honshu! Beginning in a fortified town, search for your opponent's Regent, being sure to protect your own Regent at all costs.\nNatives: Zen, Jesuit\nOutlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai

Players must protect their Regent or lose the game!
 
Start at either end of a long and narrow island. Few mines are to be found on the starting continent, but smaller islands with valuable mines lie just offshore. On the opposite coast, players will find a landmass featuring a Trade Route. A short supply of Food on the main island may drive players to fish from the sea.
 
 
Natives: Zen, Jesuit
Outlaws: Mangudai, Masterless Samurai
Upper Himalayas: the same chokepoints of the Himalayas but without the Trade Route to obstruct your wall placement.\nNatives: Udasi, Bhakti\nOutlaws: Mangudai, Fugitive Dacoit

Gain control of this expanded map's vital choke points to restrict your enemies' access to the most valuable resources. Players start with Town Centers in close proximity to thick forests. Beyond the trees, in the lush central valley, vast quantities of Food and Gold lie ripe for the taking. Beware, as established native settlements dot the landscape.
 
 
Natives: Udasi, Bhakti
Outlaws: Mangudai, Fugitive Dacoit

Himalayas: a series of geographic chokepoints stand in the way of abundant natural resources. A Trade Route runs through this mountainous region.\nNatives: Udasi, Bhakti\nOutlaws: Mangudai, Fugitive Dacoit

Gain control of vital choke points on the map to restrict your enemies' access to the most valuable resources. Players start with Town Centers in close proximity to thick forests. Beyond the trees, in the lush central valley, vast quantities of Food and Gold lie ripe for the taking. A Trade Route runs through this mountainous region; but beware, established native settlements also dot the landscape.
 
 
Natives: Udasi, Bhakti
Outlaws: Mangudai, Fugitive Dacoit
Ceylon: migrate by sea to a large, resource-rich continent.\nNatives: Bhakti, Zen\nOutlaws: Fugitive Dacoit, Delinquent Thuggee

Players begin on a humble patch of rock rising up from the middle of the sea. Fortunes will be sought on the central island, as players must migrate to establish bases on this resource rich coast. Wild beasts roam the island's northern region, while Gold mines and ancient Treasures can be found nestled amongst the cliffs to the south. Your Home City has prepared well for this expedition, so your first Shipment will be available quickly.
 
 
Natives: Bhakti, Zen
Outlaws: Fugitive Dacoit, Delinquent Thuggee
Borneo: a resource-rich island with lucrative Trade Routes in the interior, and surrounded by well-charted waters.\nNatives: Jesuit, Sufi\nOutlaws: Smuggler, Fugitive Dacoit

With a rich coastal region and a bountiful interior, the island of Borneo promises endless opportunities for expansion and conflict. Each team has access to a Trade Route servicing the breadth of the island, where a wealth of Gold and Food may be discovered by those willing to brave the dense jungle. The waters around the island are visible at the start of the game, and are ripe for fishing.
 
 
Natives: Jesuit, Sufi
Outlaws: Smuggler, Fugitive Dacoit

All is lost. The convoy has reached its destination. We have failed our friends.

Year of the Goat Shipment has arrived.
Year of the Ox Shipment has arrived.
Farmer: Have you seen my pet duck Chiko? Here, Chiko!
Farmer: You will know my pet duck if you find him. He's losing his feathers. He's sick.
Farmer: I love to hug my pet duck Chiko. This is odd. Why are my hands numb, and purple?
Farmer: My pet duck Chiko is my best friend. I think that's why I feel so queasy. It's love.
Geisha: The bluest sky dims; for I have lost my love for you; the clouds will darken
Geisha: Peace in this sunlight, but showers forever fall: such is a man's life.
Geisha: War is a sad tide: overpowering waves, wash all of us now.
Geisha: A city of hope, like a flower opens wide, a new life for all.
Girl: I should totally break up with Tomo. He's acting like a supreme jerk.
Girl: Who does Kisho think he is, anyway? I am, like, a huge catch.
Girl: Wow. Is this ever hard? Botan is cute, but Haru is the sweetest guy ever.
Girl: I can't believe Hiroshi kissed me. I am so writing about this on my blog.
Ronin: I'd take pleasure in gutting you, boy.
Ronin: Remember when I said I'd kill you last? I lied.
Ronin: What is best in life? To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentations of their women.
Ronin: Drop dead? I don't do requests.
Ronin: I'm not into politics. I'm into survival.
Samurai: Are you looking at me? Draw your sword! We fight!
Samurai: How dare you breathe my air! Draw your sword! We fight!
Samuria: Your face outrages me! Draw your sword! We fight!
Samurai: The sight of you boils my blood. Draw your sword! We fight!
Samurai: Your nose is whistling! Draw your sword! We fight!
Monk: Eyes down, mouth shut. Bide your time, Hiro...
Monk: Don't look them in the eye. They only want to make fun of you.
Monk: Some day they'll pay. They'll all pay.
Monk: Your power is growing, Hiro. Soon they will feel your wrath.
Musician: "Oh, my love, your head is like a misshapen gourd that has filled my heart with its ripened odor..."
Musician: "Oh, my beloved, I wish to nibble your toes like a plate of umeboshi, but not in a creepy way..."
Musician: "Oh, darling, I stalk your every move out of love, so please tell your father to leave me alone..."
Musician: "Oh, beautiful one, your heavy, lumbering gait shakes the foundations of my heart..."
Musician: "Oh, sweet anata, ferocious hounds cannot keep me from your arms, but they did give me a limp."
Woman: I am so lonely. That bridge looks high, and the water below it looks deep. It is time.
Woman: Despair fills my heart. I shall throw myself in front of the next rickshaw I see.
Woman: Oh, sorrow, why do you torment me? If I only I could be bitten by an infected parrot.
Woman: When will this tragedy end? I shall pick a fight with a bandit. He will end my pain with his dagger.
Farmer: Interesting, the Yellow River is actually yellow. I did not see that coming.
Farmer: Wait, this isn't Hangzhou! The world's worst travel agent strikes again!
Farmer: She told me to meet her on top of the Great Wall, on Valentine's Day! Ah, love!
Farmer: I'm going to take this city by storm. Look out world. Here comes Chang!
Passive Ability: Your Monk increases the speed of nearby elephants.
Woman: Dear Diary: I arrived in the city today. It smells like a wash basin.
Woman: Dear Diary, the city is a strange place. Today, a man gave me one of his fingers.
Woman: Dear Diary, I am homesick. I miss people who apologize when they stab you.
Woman: Dear Diary, today a man asked to borrow my pants. Should I have said no?
Nobleman: There's no need to be alarmed. You're supposed to feel inferior around me.
Nobleman: I'm not wearing anything under this robe. Want to check?
Nobleman: I own that building, and that building, and that building...
Nobleman: I never realized how many commoners there are. It's so depressing.
Noblewoman: No, you may not kiss my feet.
Noblewoman: No, you may not carry my luggage.
Noblewoman: No, you may not be my whipping boy.
Noblewoman: No, you may not sniff my clothes.
Monk: Want to know the secret of enlightenment? That'll be five bucks.
Monk: Yum, dumplings! Wait! Darn it! I just broke my ten-year vow of silence.
Monk: I have taken a vow of seriousness. Please do not smile at me.
Monk: Nature may be a blessing, but this city is stinking cesspool.
Monk: I beg you. Cease checking your appearance in my head reflection.
Performer: Watch carefully, for I will now swallow a diseased monkey.
Performer: Watch carefully, for I will now eat my own face.
Performer: Watch carefully, for I will now detach my feet.
Performer: Watch carefully, for I will now explode into confetti.
Performer: Shazam! Wait, let me try that again. Shazam!
Girl: Walk, walk, walk, that's all I ever seem to do.
Girl: Sometimes it feels like people are watching me. It's creepy.
Girl: My, virtual India certainly looks beautiful this time of year.
Nobleman: My new shoes! Ruined! Uh oh, I really hope that's mud.
Nobleman: I heard that there are three elephants for every person in the city. Or was it rats?
Nobleman: Time to go home and persecute some servants!
Nobleman: I'm exhausted. That's the last time I leave home without my palkhi.
Noblewoman: That's right. I know how to work it.
Noblewoman: Take a good look. You'll want to remember me.
Noblewoman: A walk like this: you're born with it.
Noblewoman: I'm one of a kind. Well, at least in this expansion pack.
Citizen: Where can a guy go to get his cock-fight on?
Citizen: That's strange. This map says nothing about a red light district.
Citizen: I should really invest in a new robe, something flashy, maybe with sequins.
Citizen: At last! I've activated my mind powers! Now everyone will know what I'm thinking!
Monk: As your servant, I will craft a mashed potato icon in your likeness.
Monk: In your name, I shall make many donations to a clown charity.
Monk: If your will be done, I will have that special operation I've been saving for.
Monk: With your blessing, I shall lead a monkey army to victory.
Snake Charmer: Never had one lesson!
Snake Charmer: You should see what happens when I break out the tuba.
Snake Charmer: This pungi goes all the way to 11.
Snake Charmer: Yes, those are snake bites. I never said I had talent.
Snake Charmer: Don't tell anyone, but the snake gets 20 percent.

Few things on this earth frighten me. The power of the Russian army, is one of them.

I have served my master honorably...
At last, I have earned a proper rest...
My name will rise up with the ancestors...
I have fallen in the service of the emperor, as it should be...
Even with my bottle in hand, I grow colder...
No... this cannot be the end of an emperor...
For king, for country... for glory...
Never! I will not perish on this forsaken soil...
My blood nourishes the land for which I have fought...
